channel.title: Blue Shift Remake
channel.description:
I found this on ModDB: [url]https://www.moddb.com/mods/guardduty[/url]
It's only in in its very early stages but what they have so far is really high quality stuff.

item.title: Blue Shift Remake
item.dc:creator: Keresh
item.description:
1. It’s not a new remake, it’s an old one. There’s no “new” remake.
  2. You linked to files.
  3. It’s spelled bookie.
  4. This thread is for Blue Shift remake, not OBM.

item.title: Blue Shift Remake
item.dc:creator: GenericPlayerX
item.description:
GordonFreeManz:

Then all the sudden, hell break loose and your only armed with an Berreta M92 and a crowbar. You have to save the scientists… and it’s just an awesome game.

If your recall the introductory text, First priority is to protect the facility and equipment, then the personnel, then finally yourself. Get your priorities straight man! >

My only complaint with Blue Shift was that it was as expensive as Opposing Force and did not include any the new things introduced in Opposing Force. It really felt like a better-than-average mod of HL1 than a real expansion of the official story-line. Obviously, it sets up Barney Calhoun’s return in HL2, but I think it was not as much as it should have been.

Read full topic

item.title: Blue Shift Remake
item.dc:creator: GordonFreeManz
item.description:
Disturbulator:

I kind of feel the same way about Black Mesa.

Blue Shift wasn’t nearly as long as Half-Life, so hopefully the mod shouldn’t take as long to finish.

I liked Blue Shift.
Partially, because you were just an ordinary Security Officer.
Then all the sudden, hell break loose and your only armed with an Berreta M92 and a crowbar. You have to save the scientists… and it’s just an awesome game.
I love all the Half-Life games. Pretty much… VALVE games are awesome.

:freeman:

:3

Read full topic

item.title: Blue Shift Remake
item.dc:creator: Disturbulator
item.description:
Well let me reply away:

Half-Life was a stunning game to play because its atmosphere and storyline were gripping.
Opposing Force was close, the story of Shepard diddn’t begin until after the cascade had occured.
In both, you play as someone who is rather ‘fit’ for such a situation.
-Gordon has his badass HEV suit
-Shepard has a military-grade HECU suit.
However, Barney Calhoun is just a Security Officer.
His story begins at the same time as Gordon’s.
Barney’s point of view seems closer to just a regular ‘bystander’ caught up in the comotion as you watch the effects of the Ressonance Cascade unfold before.
-Barney only has a Black Mesa Security Officer Official Uniform on him, which at most gives him some kevlar.
-Barney, unlike Gordon or Shepard, isn’t fixed on finding the source of the catastophe and sealing up the rifts, he just wants to get the fuck out, and gets help from scientists along the way.

      Half-Life: Blue Shift reminds me a lot about Half-Life 2: Episode 1, which is my favorite episode. Both are quick, action-packed, and are full of new and dynamic atmosphere.
      I like the feeling of crysis as you try to escape a horrid scenario that continues to deteriorate around you, which is why I am anticipating the remake of Guard Duty the most.

Those are my two cents.

Read full topic

item.title: Blue Shift Remake
item.dc:creator: Aze
item.description:
Disturbulator:

In all honesty, I’m more pumped for the Blue Shift remake then the Decay, Half-Life, or Opposing Force remakes (doesn’t mean I wont love them though).

Luigis #1:

Out of curiosity may I ask why you look forward to the Blue Shift remake the most?

^ I would love to hear it too, since I personally think Blue Shift is the “shittiest” Half-Life game ever made. (It’s not “Need for Speed shitty” because a Half-Life game can’t be that bad, but still it’s not half as good as the others)

Read full topic

I’m more excited for Decay out of all the expansions because I’ve never even played it before, and it’s probably got one of the greatest ‘seen from a different perspective’ parts in the expansions. Namely, listening to what happens in the test chamber from WAY up above.
